title: Holocaust: Dutch PM apologises over failure to protect Jews
description: Mark Rutte is the first prime minister to acknowledge the Netherlands' role in persecuting Jews.

title: Kobe Bryant's poem 'Dear Basketball'
description: Watch Kobe Bryant's poem 'Dear Basketball', written when the five-time NBA champion retired in 2016, following reports the basketball legend has died in a helicopter crash.

title: Para-swimmer Grace Harvey speaks about walking in a robotic suit
description: Grace Harvey reveals the mixed emotions she had after walking for the first time in a robotic suit.

title: Why Australia probably doesn't need more koala mittens
description: Canada sent thousands of crafts to help animals, but local rescue groups say they are overwhelmed.

title: Australian Open: Roger Federer reaches quarter-finals with win over Marton Fucsovics
description: Six-time Australian Open champion Roger Federer comes from behind to beat Marton Fucsovics and reach the quarter-finals.

title: Labour: Anti-Semitism claims used to undermine Corbyn - McCluskey
description: But Unite's Len McCluskey also says Labour "never handled the anti-Semitism issue correctly".

title: HS2: Cabinet minister has 'gut feeling' rail project will be cleared
description: Brexit Secretary Stephen Barclay tells the BBC he believes the high-speed rail project will go ahead.

title: China coronavirus: Road blocks and ghost towns
description: A BBC team travels into Hubei province, where the deadly new coronavirus originated.

title: Man wrongfully arrested given £100k compensation by police
description: Gary Webb was handcuffed and spent a night in a police cell and three nights in prison in 2015.

title: Coronavirus: Airlift for Britons trapped in China 'under review'
description: The government says it is closely monitoring the situation in Hubei province, where the virus began.

title: China coronavirus 'spreads before symptoms show'
description: The new coronavirus is said to be infectious during its incubation period, making to harder to contain.

title: Trump ordered to remove envoy in Ukraine in 2018 - video
description: In a video, the president is heard saying "Get rid of her!" about ambassador Marie Yovanovitch.

title: Gauff's Australian Open run ended by Kenin
description: Coco Gauff misses out on her first Grand Slam quarter-final as fellow American Sofia Kenin fights back to win in the Australian Open fourth round.

title: The art of having a memorial bench for a loved one
description: Dedicated benches can be a place of solace, but may only be temporary and costs can be prohibitive.

title: 'Buy now, pay later' users almost double
description: Deals allowing customers to spread payments interest-free are increasing but charities warn of building debts.

title: Brexit day 50p coin unveiled by Chancellor Sajid Javid
description: It comes after the original batch of coins had to be melted down when the Brexit deadline was extended.

title: How a teenager had 30 cosmetic procedures without showing ID
description: A 17-year-old girl had £15,000 worth of cosmetic procedures without ever having to prove her age.

title: Grime ballet 'sounds like an oxymoron'
description: The makers of "the world's first grime ballet" want to encourage black people into the discipline.

title: Boeing 777X: World’s largest twin-engine jet completes first flight
description: The 777X test flight comes after Boeing's 737 Max plane was grounded following two fatal crashes.

title: Coronavirus: Could it damage the global economy?
description: Inevitably, it will have economic consequences. But how severe and how far will they spread?

title: Grammys 2020: Seven things to watch out for - and how to watch the ceremony
description: The key facts for Sunday's show - from BTS and Lil Nas X to the controversy over vote-rigging.

title: The Shetland dog models whose photoshoots can stop traffic
description: Kaylee Garrick has trained her pets to pose together - and their fame has spread across the globe.

title: Lesotho's murder mystery, Prime Minister Tom Thabane and his estranged wife
description: Lesotho's prime minister and his wife are caught up in an investigation into the death of his former partner.

title: Beatles, Rolling Stones and more album covers as pottery
description: Sculptor Simon Buckmaster celebrates the golden age of the album cover in clay.

title: Forensic science: How pollen is a silent witness to solving murders
description: Learning about nature in Wales sparked an interest which led to a woman's career in forensic ecology.

title: Naturist campsite footpath rerouted after privacy fears
description: The campsite's owner says she is "relieved it's over and done with" after almost two years.

title: The tiger ‘gift’ that horrified Polish rescuers
description: Tigers recovering from a nightmare journey could have ended up as Asian ‘medicine’

title: Three women who were part of a quiet resistance against the Nazis in Berlin
description: The three were part of a quiet resistance against the Nazis in Second World War Berlin.
